page.title: 01MOORLAND NORTH OF PORTREE
page.content: The road to Staffin runs through heather moorland between the crags of the Trotternish Ridge and the cliffs on the eastern shore overlooking the sound og Raasay. Here the road is single-track with passing-places. It follows the valley of the river Chracaig then crosses the watershed and drops down to Loch Fada (2), one of the Storr Lochs. Cattle and sheep are grazed on the moorland and about a dozen families cut peat in square (2,6 and 10). These people live in Portree. There is a new fank at the head of Loch Fada (2). The cliffs in 4, 8 and 12 are spectacular, high basalt sills overlaying jurassic limestone rich in fossils. Oolitic limestone outcrops in rhe Chracaigburn as well. Prince Charle's Cave is reputed to be one of the hiding places of the young pretender and is pointed out to
